after rain comes funshine
this is a metaphor or an allegorical
phrase that is meant to communicate the
idea that after a dark experience or
period of life there's a light one that
follows after bad comes good essentially
you can use this one in either formal or
informal settings you should pay
attention to pronouncing the word
sunshine while seeing the praise every
cloud has a silver lining
this phrase means that you can find
something positive in any bad situation
rain clouds are often dark in color or
gloomy however if you watch the clouds
for a while you can sometimes see the
sun shining behind that this can make
the edge or lining of the cloud appear a
silver color much brighter and lighter
than the rest of the cloud as dark
clouds can have the silver lining
equally when life seems bad there's

matters let's see the following example
at the beginning I was afraid of
learning Mandarin but now I'll just go

showing somebody that you believe in

what's wrong I

this phrase is used in an informal way
